intro: Adicea pendula, commonly known as the weeping star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its drooping, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant produces clusters of white or pale blue flowers that hang from slender stems, creating a striking visual effect. Its leaves are strap-shaped and evergreen, providing a lush backdrop to the flowering display. Adicea pendula is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively low-maintenance once established.
